meanings.definition: Hemipterans: insects of the order Hemiptera, characterized by piercing-sucking mouthparts
meanings.sent1: The hemipterans feed by piercing and sucking on plants.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hemipterans to understand their feeding habits.
meanings.sent3: The hemipterans had a party, but instead of snacks, they brought tiny straws.
meanings.sent4: In the garden, the hemipterans acted like tiny vampires, extracting nutrients from the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The hemipterans' mouthparts are like tiny needles, perfect for extracting plant juices.

meanings.definition: Hemipterans: a group of insects that includes true bugs, cicadas, and leafhoppers
meanings.sent1: Many farmers are familiar with the damage caused by hemipterans like leafhoppers.
meanings.sent2: In the forest, you can hear the buzzing of cicadas, a type of hemipterans.
meanings.sent3: The true bugs and other hemipterans had a race to see who could jump the farthest.
meanings.sent4: The garden was alive with the hum of hemipterans, a symphony of insect sounds.
meanings.sent5: Children love to catch cicadas, one of the most well-known hemipterans.
